MPC

Class ScanInStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • MPC.ScanInStream

  • public class ScanInStream
extends java.lang.Object
    Adds line and column number functionality to an ordinary Java InputStream. Also remembers the current line of input for nice scanner error messages.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int col
      current column position in the InputStream; the first character of each line is at column 1 (the preceding newline is viewed as being at column 0)
      private short inChar
      the next input character; it is a short so that we can mark end of file as well (by using 0400).
      private java.io.InputStream inStr
      the underlying character InputStream
      private java.lang.StringBuffer lineBuf
      current input line, for error messages, etc.
      private int pos
      current file position in the InputStream; the first character is at position 0
      private int tokenPos
      file position at which the current token started; -1 means not yet started

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScanInStream(java.io.InputStream inStr)
      The obvious constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      short advance()
      advance the input by one character, updating pos, inChar, etc.
      int getEndPos()
      accessor to acquire the current input position
      java.lang.String getInputLine()
      accessor to observe the current input line
      int getPos()
      accessor to acquire the input position where the current token began
      short inChar()
      accessor to observe the current input character
      void inToken()
      indicate that we are now in a token (we may already be so)
      void reset()
      indicate that we have not yet started a token

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
